string-array.name: glossary_terms
string-array.item: Banzuke|The official ranking list of Sumo wrestlers, published before each grand tournament.
Kimarite|The winning technique used to end a Sumo match. There are over 82 official kimarite.
Dohyo|The ring in which Sumo bouts are held. It is made of a specific type of clay and covered in a layer of sand.
Mawashi|The loincloth worn by rikishi during practice and competition.
Heya|A Sumo stable or "beya," where wrestlers live, train, and eat together.
Ozeki|The second-highest rank in Sumo, below Yokozuna.
Yokozuna|The highest rank a rikishi can achieve. Once promoted, a Yokozuna cannot be demoted.
Basho|A grand Sumo tournament. There are six official basho held each year.
Torikumi|A schedule of bouts for a particular day of a tournament.
